p: In the pharmaceutical industry, terpenes are used as excipients to enhance skin penetration of active principles [ 135] and as therapeutic agents endowed with numerous bioactivities including, as mentioned above, chemo-preventive, antimicrobial, antifungal, antiviral, antihyperglycemic, analgesic, anti-inflammatory, and antiparasitic activities [ 110, 111, 118, 122]. Among the pharmaceuticals, the anticancer paclitaxel and antimalarial artemisinin are two of the most renowned terpene-based drugs.
